title: DashOps Project v2
description: The file format for DashOps projects

Tags.title: Tags
Tags.description: A list of tags. Tags group actions together.

Facets.title: Facets
Facets.description: A map with values for a number of facets. Facets organize actions into perspectives and provide values for placeholders.

working-directory.title: Working Directory
working-directory.description:
A path to the working directory.

If the path is relative, it is resolved relative to the current working directory of DashOps.
If the path is not set or empty, the current working directory of DashOps is used as base path.

environment.title: Environment
environment.description: A map with additional environment variables

exe-paths.title: Executable Paths
exe-paths.description: Additional paths for the environment variable PATH

exit-codes.title: Exit Codes
exit-codes.description:
A list with exit codes considered successfull.
The default is just 0.

use-powershell-core.title: Use PowerShell Core
use-powershell-core.description: Use PowerShell (not Windows PowerShell) as the execution environment for an action

powershell-exe.title: PowerShell Executable
powershell-exe.description: A path to a PowerShell executable as the execution environment for an action. Overrides the use-powershell-core setting.

use-powershell-profile.title: Use PowerShell Profile
use-powershell-profile.description: A switch to activate loading the PowerShell profile when executing an action

powershell-execution-policy.title: PowerShell Execution Policy
powershell-execution-policy.description: Sets the execution policy for the PowerShell

use-windows-terminal.title: Use Windows Terminal
use-windows-terminal.description: A switch to activate using the Windows Terminal instead of the classic console host

windows-terminal-args.title: Windows Terminal Arguments
windows-terminal-args.description: Command line arguments for the Windows Terminal

headers.title: Headers
headers.description: A map with HTTP headers to use send with the request

http-timeout.title: HTTP Timeout
http-timeout.description: A timeout in seconds for the HTTP request

no-tls-verify.title: No TLS Verification
no-tls-verify.description: A switch to ignore TLS verification errors

server-certificate-hash.title: Server Certificate Hash
server-certificate-hash.description: An expected SHA1 hash of the server certificate in hexadecimal format

status-codes.title: HTTP Status Codes
status-codes.description:
A list with HTTP status codes considered successfull.

The default is 200 – 204.

reassure.title: Reassure Execution
reassure.description: A switch to activate a confirmation dialog, prior to executing the action

background.title: Run In Background
background.description: A switch to activate hidden execution, without a visible terminal window

keep-open.title: Keep Open
keep-open.description: A switch to set the behavior for the terminal window after finishing an action. If true, the terminal window is kept open, even if the action succeeded.

always-close.title: Always Close
always-close.description: A switch to set the behavior for the terminal window after finishing an action. If true, the terminal window is closed, even if the action failed.

logs.title: Logging Directory
logs.description: A path to a directory to store logs in

no-execution-info.title: No Execution Info in Logs
no-execution-info.description: A switch to suppress header and footer with execution info when writing log files

deactivated.title: Deactivated
deactivated.description: A switch to exclude the monitor from automatic execution

interval.title: Interval
interval.description: The number of seconds between automatic executions of a monitor

logs.title: Logging Directory
logs.description: A path to a directory to store logs in

required-patterns.title: Required Patterns
required-patterns.description: A list with regular expressions, which must match the output from a command or the text response from a HTTP request. If one of the regular expressions does not match, the monitor fails.

forbidden-patterns.title: Forbidden Patterns
forbidden-patterns.description: A list of regular expressions, which must not match the output from a command or the text response from a HTTP request. I one of the regular expressions does match, the monitor fails.

DefaultSettings.title: Defaults
DefaultSettings.description: A number of default settings for actions and monitors

for-actions.title: Action Defaults
for-actions.description: A number of default settings for actions

for-monitors.title: Monitor Defaults
for-monitors.description: A number of default settings for monitors

description.title: Action Description
description.description:
The text displayed on the action button.

Placeholders like ${facet} are replaced by the facet value.

command.title: Command
command.description:
The command of the action.

The command is executed inside of a PowerShell session.
Environment variables in CMD syntax like %AppData% are expanded.

arguments.title: Command Line Arguments
arguments.description:
The command line arguments of the action.

Placeholders like ${facet} are replaced by the facets value.
Environment variables in CMD syntax like %AppData% are expanded.

CommandActionDiscovery.title: Action Discovery
CommandActionDiscovery.description: An action discovery, which generates an action for each matched file path.

base-path.title: Base Path
base-path.description:
The base path to search for files.

If the path is relative, it is resolved relative to the current working directory of DashOps.
If the path is not set or empty, the current working directory of DashOps is used as base path.

path-pattern.title: Path Pattern
path-pattern.description:
A regular expression matching a relative file path below the base path.

Captured named groups in the expression are treated as facets.

interpreter.title: Interpreter
interpreter.description:
By default the discovered files are treated as PowerShell scripts or executables.
With this property, another interpreter can be specified.

Placeholders like ${facet} are replaced by the facets value.
Environment variables in CMD syntax like %AppData% are expanded.

arguments.title: Command Line Arguments
arguments.description:
The command line arguments of the action.

The placeholder ${file} is replaced by the absolute path of the discovered file.
Placeholders like ${facet} are replaced by the facets value.
Environment variables in CMD syntax like %AppData% are expanded.

CommandActionPattern.title: Action Pattern
CommandActionPattern.description:
An action pattern, which generates a field of command actions.

The facet values of the action pattern are combined in all possible combinations, to instantiate actual actions.
Given an action pattern which has three facets with 2, 3, and 4 values. Then 2 * 3 * 4 = 24 actions are instantiated.

facets.title: Facets
facets.description: A list of values for a number of facets

oneOf.title: Description Action Predicate
oneOf.description:
A regular expression to match against the description of actions.

Is true, if the pattern matches the description of the action.

pattern.title: Description Pattern
pattern.description: A regular expression matched against the description of the action

oneOf.title: Description Action Predicate
oneOf.description:
A constant string to compare with the description of actions.

Is true, if the value equals the description of the action.

value.title: Description Value
value.description: An exact description compared with the description of the action

oneOf.title: Command Action Predicate
oneOf.description:
A regular expression to match against the command of actions.

Is true, if the pattern matches the command of the action.

pattern.title: Command Pattern
pattern.description: A regular expression matched against the command of the action

oneOf.title: Command Action Predicate
oneOf.description:
A constant string to match against the command of actions.

Is true, if the value equals the command of the action.

value.title: Command Value
value.description: An exact command compared with the command of the action

oneOf.title: Facet Action Predicate
oneOf.description:
A reguölar expression to match against the facets of actions.

Is true, if the pattern matches the value of the given facet.

pattern.title: Facet Pattern
pattern.description: A regular expression matched against the facet value

oneOf.title: Facet Action Predicate
oneOf.description:
A constant string to match against the facets of actions.

Is true, if the value equals the value of the given facet.

value.title: Facet Value
value.description: The exact facet value to compare

oneOf.title: Tag Action Predicate
oneOf.description:
A regular expression to match against the tags of actions.

Is true, if the pattern matches one of the tags of the action.

pattern.title: Tag Pattern
pattern.description: A regular expression matched against the tags of the action

oneOf.title: Tag Action Predicate
oneOf.description:
A constant string to match against the tags of actions.

Is true, if the value equals one of the tags of the action.

AutoActionSettings.title: Auto Action Settings
AutoActionSettings.description:
Apply these settings automatically to matching actions.

Facets and tags added by auto settings, are NOT considered when evaluating the include and exclude predicates.
Facets added by auto settings, are NOT considered when expanding placeholders in action settings.

include.title: Include Predicates
include.description: Apply the settings only to actions, that match ALL of the predicates in this list. If the list is empty, all actions are included.

exclude.title: Exclude Predicates
exclude.description: Apply the settings only to actions, that match NONE of the predicates in this list. If the list is empty, no actions are excluded.

title.title: Title
title.description:
The title of the monitor in the UI.

In discovered monitors and monitor patterns, placeholder like ${var} are replaced by variable values.

arguments.title: Command Line Arguments
arguments.description:
The command line arguments of the monitor.

In discovered monitors and monitor patterns, placeholder like ${var} are replaced by variable values.
In discoverey monitors, the placeholder ${file} is replaced by the absolute path of the discovered file.
Environment variables in CMD syntax like %AppData% are expanded.

CommandMonitor.title: Command Monitor
CommandMonitor.description: A monitor, that runs a PowerShell script or executable

command.title: Command
command.description:
The command of the monitor.

The command is executed inside of a PowerShell session.
Environment variables in CMD syntax like %AppData% are expanded.

CommandMonitorDiscovery.title: Command Monitor Discovery
CommandMonitorDiscovery.description: A monitor discovery, which generates a monitor for each matched file path

base-path.title: Base Path
base-path.description:
The base path to search for files.

If the path is relative, it is resolved relative to the current working directory of DashOps.
If the path is not set or empty, the current working directory of DashOps is used as base path.

path-pattern.title: Path Pattern
path-pattern.description:
A regular expression matching a relative file path below the base path.

Captured named groups in the expression are treated as variables.

interpreter.title: Interpreter
interpreter.description:
By default the discovered files are treated as PowerShell scripts or executables.
With this property, another interpreter can be specified.

Placeholders like ${var} are replaced by the variable value.
Environment variables in CMD syntax like %AppData% are expanded.

arguments.title: Command Line Arguments
arguments.description:
The command line arguments of the action.

The placeholder ${file} is replaced by the absolute path of the discovered file.
Placeholders like ${var} are replaced by the variable value.
Environment variables in CMD syntax like %AppData% are expanded.

CommandMonitorPattern.title: Command Monitor Pattern
CommandMonitorPattern.description:
A monitor pattern, which generates a field of command monitors.

The variable values of the monitor pattern are combined in all possible combinations, to instantiate actual monitors.
Given a monitor pattern which has three variables with 2, 3, and 4 values. Then 2 * 3 * 4 = 24 monitors are instantiated.

variables.title: Variables
variables.description: A list of values for a number of variables

url.title: URL
url.description: The address of the HTTP endpoint

WebMonitor.title: Web Monitor
WebMonitor.description: A monitor which calls an HTTP endpoint with the GET method

WebMonitorPattern.title: Web Monitor Pattern
WebMonitorPattern.description:
A monitor pattern, which generates a field of web monitors.

The variable values of the monitor pattern are combined in all possible combinations, to instantiate actual monitors.
Given a monitor pattern which has three variables with 2, 3, and 4 values. Then 2 * 3 * 4 = 24 monitors are instantiated.

variables.title: Variables
variables.description: A list of values for a number of variables

version.title: Project Format
version.description: The version number of the project format

title.title: Project Title
title.description: A descriptive title for the project

perspectives.title: Perspectives
perspectives.description: A selection of facets, to use as perspectives in the UI

startup-perspective.title: Start-Up Perspective
startup-perspective.description: Defines the pre-selected perspective on start-up. Can be either the keyword 'tags', or a facet name.

startup-selection.title: Start-Up Selection
startup-selection.description: Defines the pre-selected facet value or tag on start-up. Requires the startup-perspective property to be set.

pause-monitoring.title: Pause Monitoring
pause-monitoring.description: A switch to prevent the automatic start of monitors on startup

auto-settings.title: Auto Settings
auto-settings.description: A number of automatically applied settings

for-actions.title: Auto Action Settings
for-actions.description: A number of automatically applied settings for actions

action-discovery.title: Action Discovery
action-discovery.description: A list of actions, implicitly defined by the existence of files

action-patterns.title: Action Patterns
action-patterns.description: A list of action patterns, that will expand into a multi-dimensional field of actions

monitors.title: Command Monitors
monitors.description: A list with explicit command monitors

monitor-discovery.title: Command Monitor Discovery
monitor-discovery.description: A list of command monitors, implicitly defined by the existence of files

monitor-patterns.title: Command Monitor Patterns
monitor-patterns.description: A list of monitor patterns, that will expand into a multi-dimensional field of command monitors

web-monitors.title: Web Monitors
web-monitors.description: A list with explicit web monitors

web-monitor-patterns.title: Web Monitor Patterns
web-monitor-patterns.description: A list of monitor patterns, that will expand into a multi-dimensional field of web monitors
